name: demoralizingly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that makes you lose confidence, enthusiasm, and hope: The pay and facilities available to staff are demoralizingly poor. We were dragged off to a demoralisingly wet hillside for Army-style training.
More examplesFewer examplesThe winter was not ultra-cold, but it was demoralizingly long.A great deal of money and manpower was thrown at the campaign, and it had demoralisingly little effect.The report claimed that schools have demoralizingly low expectations of poor students.The exercise can be helpful, but it is often demoralizingly difficult.
